description: Calculate the surface area of a cone given its radius and height. The formula is πr(r + sqrt(r² + h²)), where r is the radius, h is the height, and sqrt(r² + h²) is the slant height.
input_format: Two space-separated numbers representing the radius and height of the cone.
output_format: A single floating-point number representing the total surface area of the cone, printed with 14 decimal places.
prompt:
; Calculate the surface area of a cone given its radius and height. The formula is πr(r + sqrt(r² + h²)), where r is the radius, h is the height, and sqrt(r² + h²) is the slant height.
; Input format: Two space-separated numbers representing the radius and height of the cone.
; Output format: A single floating-point number representing the total surface area of the cone, printed with 14 decimal places.

#lang racket
completions:
(define (surface-area-of-cone radius height)
  (let ((slant-height (sqrt (+ (sqr radius) (sqr height)))))
    (* pi radius (+ radius slant-height))))

; Example usage:
; (surface-area-of-cone 3 4) ; Expected output: 75.39822368615503
; (surface-area-of-cone 5 12) ; Expected output: 282.74333882308138
